00019 /**
00020  * @file   MatrixCheck.h
00021  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00022  * @date   Tue Apr 25 16:12:22 2006
00023  * 
00024  * @brief Class for doing a check of two matrix files after regression run.
00025  */
00026 #ifndef MATRIXCHECK_H
00027 #define MATRIXCHECK_H
00028 
00029 //
00030 #include "util/Fs.h"
00031 #include "util/RegressionCheck.h"
00032 #include "util/Util.h"
00033 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00034 //
00035 #include <cassert>
00036 #include <cstdlib>
00037 #include <cstring>
00038 #include <string>
00039 //
00040 
00041 /**
00042  * Class for testing that two files are the same +/- some
00043  * epsilon. Currently only supports tab separated matrixes of
00044  * numerical data.
00045  */
00046 class MatrixCheck : public RegressionCheck {
00047 
00048 public:
00049 
00050   /** 
00051    * Constructor.
00052    * 
00053    * @param generated - File created by application being tested.
00054    * @param gold - File believed to be "truth"
00055    * @param eps - Maximum absolute difference from truth acceptable.
00056    * @param rowSkip - Number of rows to skip before comparing.
00057    * @param colSkip - Number of columns to skip before comparing.
00058    * @param matchNames - Should we try to match the names using
00059    *                     first column? Useful when the files aren't
00060    *                     necessarily in same order.
00061    * @param allowedMisMatch - How many can we get wrong before failing?
00062    * @param frac - Maximum fractional difference from truth acceptable
00063    */
00064   MatrixCheck(
00065                 const std::string &generated, 
00066                 const std::string &gold, 
00067                 double eps, 
00068                 int rowSkip, 
00069                 int colSkip, 
00070                 bool matchNames, 
00071                 unsigned int allowedMisMatch, 
00072                                 double frac = 0.0 ) :
00073     m_Generated(generated), m_Gold(gold), m_Epsilon(eps), m_Fraction(frac), 
00074     m_RowSkip(rowSkip), m_ColSkip(colSkip), m_MatchNames(matchNames),
00075     m_AllowedMisMatch(allowedMisMatch), m_PrintMismatch(false), m_PrintMismatchMax(-1) { 
00076     m_Name = Fs::basename(generated);
00077     }
00078 
00079   /** 
00080    * Utility function to enable/disable reporting of individual differences
00081    * @param print - mismatches printed if true, not printed if false.
00082    * @return - void
00083    */
00084   void setPrintMismatch(bool print) {
00085     m_PrintMismatch = print;
00086   }
00087 
00088   /** 
00089    * Utility function to set the max number of mismatches reported
00090    * @param max - maximum number of mismatches to report (set to -1 for no limit default behavior)
00091    * @return - void
00092    */
00093   void setPrintMismatchMax(int max) {
00094     m_PrintMismatchMax = max;
00095   }
00096 
00097   /** 
00098    * Check to make sure that two files are the same +/- some epsilon. 
00099    * @param msg - Fills in an error message if test fails, empty string otherwise.
00100    * @return - Returns true if files are close enough, false otherwise.
00101    */
00102   bool check(std::string &msg) {
00103     std::string generated(m_Generated), gold(m_Gold);
00104     msg = "";
00105     bool success = true;
00106     // Fix pathnames to work for this platform.
00107     generated = Fs::convertToUncPath(generated);
00108     gold = Fs::convertToUncPath(gold);
00109     /* Santiy checks. */
00110     if (!Fs::isReadable(generated)) {
00111       msg += "Can't open file: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(generated)+" to read.";
00112       return false;
00113     }
00114     if (!Fs::isReadable(gold.c_str())) {
00115       msg += "Can't open file: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(gold)+" to read.";
00116       return false;
00117     }
00118     if(!(m_ColSkip >= 0 && m_RowSkip >= 0 && m_Epsilon >= 0)) {
00119       msg += "invalid ColSkip, RowSkip, and/or Epsilon";
00120       return false;
00121     }
00122     /* Count up differences. */
00123     // push handler to throw exception
00124     Err::setThrowStatus(true); 
00125     int diffCount;
00126     try {
00127         diffCount = Util::matrixDifferences(generated.c_str(), gold.c_str(), 
00128                                             m_ColSkip, m_RowSkip, m_Epsilon, m_PrintMismatch, m_MatchNames, 
00129                                                                                         m_Fraction, m_PrintMismatchMax );
00130     } 
00131     catch(Except &e) {
00132         msg += "Caught exception: " + ToStr(e.what());
00133         return false;
00134     }
00135     Err::setThrowStatus(true); 
00136 
00137     if(diffCount > (int)m_AllowedMisMatch) {
00138       success = false;
00139       msg += "File: " + generated + " vs " + gold + ": ";
00140       msg += ToStr("Expecting no more than ") + ToStr(m_AllowedMisMatch) + ToStr(" found: ") + ToStr(diffCount);
00141     }
00142     return success;
00143   }
00144 
00145 
00146   std::string m_Generated;   ///< File created by application being tested.
00147   std::string m_Gold;        ///< File believed to be "truth"
00148   double m_Epsilon;      ///< Maximum abosolute difference from truth acceptable.
00149   double m_Fraction;     ///< Maximum fractional difference from truth acceptable
00150   int m_RowSkip;        ///< Number of rows to skip before comparing.
00151   int m_ColSkip;        ///< Number of columns to skip before comparing.
00152   bool m_MatchNames;    ///< Should we try to match the names using
00153                         ///  first column? Useful when the files aren't
00154                         ///  necessarily in same order.
00155   unsigned int m_AllowedMisMatch;  ///< How many can we get wrong before failing?
00156   bool m_PrintMismatch;   ///< Mismatches printed if true, not printed if false.
00157   int m_PrintMismatchMax; ///< Maximum number of mismatches to print (default -1 for no limit)
00158 };
00159 
00160 #endif /* MATRIXCHECK_H */
